\rsthB{Experience}\label{experience}
\textbf{Senior Python Developer for Thirstie (CLOS19)}

MicroServices using Async Python 3.7 with Static Type hints, Postgres, Peewee, Celery, Docker Linux (GitHub), with a distributed team of 2 developers from Argentina, we designed and started the code from zero. 2019.

\textbf{CTO for OptiAgro}

CTO working remotely AGTech Python projects for Argentinean Startup OptiAgro. (Canceled by CEO) 2018.

\textbf{Senior Open Source Python Developer for Twilio}

I maintained all Twilio Python APIs and documentations, some NodeJS/Ruby too, on GitHub, with a distributed team of 5 developers, peer reviews of all repos, documentation, R\&D, tutorials, bug fix, features, technical translation, juniors mentoring, and more. (Temporal Staff Augmentation) 2016\symbol{126}2017.

\textbf{Senior Python Developer and Technical Leader for National Geographic}

I maintained all NatGeo websites for years, all Python/Django based, with a team of 5\symbol{126}15 people, projects like YourShot, MemberCenter, NatGeo, WPF, IconGS, Mortar, other internal-only software, etc.

On parallel working with clients like Electronic Arts, Lionel, SEARS/Kmart, Howarth, AON, BSD, etc. International Teams from USA, Canada, Colombia, Germany, India, Arab E., Uruguay, Argentina, etc. Python FullStack, experience on Django, HTML5, CSS3, JS, CoffeeScript. (until NatGeo get bought) 2009\symbol{126}2016.

\textbf{Freelance Senior Developer/Cooperative Partner for Open Contracting Data Standard}

Python Developer and docs translator for Open Contracting development. (Canceled) \symbol{126}3 Months, 2017.

\textbf{Freelance independent Python Developer for Empeopled Social Network}

Python2 Linux Web development, Home-working on Backend work. (Canceled) 2015\symbol{126}2016.

\rsthA{About Me}\label{about-me}
Keen with Linux, actual Arch Linux user, previously Debian/Ubuntu, worked with CentOS/RedHat too. I can effectively communicate technical information to non-technical people, I like to make things simpler. I like to write Documentation, manually or self-documenting, technical or end-user. As a self-taught person, for me programming is always learning new things, is an adventure of a lifetime.

I like to code Open Source at \href{https://github.com/juancarlospaco}{GitHub on my spare time, mostly Python and Nim.}

\href{https://nimwc.org/login}{I created my own Web Framework from scratch with unique features not seen on other frameworks.} To mention a few is the first Web Framework in the world thats \href{https://github.com/ThomasTJdev/nim\_websitecreator\#features}{Self-Firejailing (it Firejails itself), with 2 Factor Authentication by default, Security Hardened by default,} still WYSIWYG \& Drag'n'Drop for basic pages, and has its own App Store built-in. Consider that one of my best works.

\href{https://t.me/NimArgentina}{I started the Nim Argentina community on Spanish.} \href{http://pyar.org.ar}{Also I participate on PyAr Python Developers Argentina Group, a big programming community on Argentina.}

\href{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/nim-nimterlingua\#nimterlingua}{Created a Translation/Internationalization library that allows to translate unmodified source code with 0 cost at runtime.}.

\href{https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Juan\_Carlos}{Coded Async Libraries for all APIs of OpenStreetMap.}

\href{https://pypi.org/user/juancarlospaco}{I have popular Python packages on pypi}, \href{https://github.com/juancarlospaco?utf8=\%E2\%9C\%93\&tab=repositories\&language=python}{I maintain +100 Repos on my GitHub}, mostly Python, a few with Cython speed-up. I have been coding Python more than 10 years, on small and big companies of the US.

I contributed to popular open source projects like \href{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/peewee-extra-fields}{Peewee}, \href{https://nuitka.net}{Nuitka}, Ninja-IDE, on the past.

\href{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/nim-pypi}{I created my own alternative to PIP (x20 times faster)} , \href{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/faster-than-requests\#faster-than-requests}{my own alternative to Requests (x20 times faster)} , \href{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/faster-than-csv\#faster-than-csv}{my own CSV module for Data Science (x5 times faster)}, \href{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/faster-than-walk\#faster-than-walk}{my own os.walk module for SSD (x9 times faster)}.

\href{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/css-html-js-minify}{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/css-html-js-minify} \href{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/css-html-prettify}{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/css-html-prettify} \href{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/microraptor}{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/microraptor} \href{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/apistar-session-cookie}{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/apistar-session-cookie} \href{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/openexchangerate}{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/openexchangerate} \href{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/anglerfish}{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/anglerfish} \href{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/unicodemoticon}{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/unicodemoticon} \href{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/apistar\_peewee}{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/apistar\_peewee} \href{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/apistar-msgpack}{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/apistar-msgpack} \href{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/netpbm}{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/netpbm} \href{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/pyvoicechanger}{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/pyvoicechanger} \href{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/octopussh}{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/octopussh}

I like to use Design By Contract, and made my own library for DbC.

Nim ---

Nim is a new typed and compiled systems \& apps programming language. It has Python Syntax and C Speed. It can do Python modules \& Frontend Web Apps (compiles to JS), lightweight \& faster than Cython, PyPy, Go.

Founder of Nim Argentina, new community of Nim developers. I am Nim Core Dev. \href{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/nim-openstreetmap}{https://github.com/juancarlospaco/nim-openstreetmap}
